description: Unknown; from Kent. Originally a piece of iron attached to a plow; sense of “thin piece of wood” from 1723, sense of “thin piece of material used for alignment or support” from 1860.

entries.meaning: A thin piece of material, sometimes tapered, used for alignment or support.
(computing) A small library that transparently intercepts and modifies calls to an API, usually for compatibility purposes.
examples: Shims intercept Win32 API calls from legacy applications, as defined by system administrators, and then modify the call before passing the code to Windows for execution.

entries.meaning: A kind of shallow plow used in tillage to break the ground and clear it of weeds.
A small metal device used to pick open a lock.

verbs.description: shim (third-person singular simple present shims, present participle shimming, simple past and past participle shimmed)

entries.meaning: To fit one or more shims to a piece of machinery.
To adjust something by using shims.
To adjust the homogeneity of a magnetic field, after the mechanical devices once used for the purpose.
(computing, transitive) To intercept and modify calls to (an API), usually for compatibility purposes.
(informal, often derogatory) A transsexual person, especially a trans woman; (loosely) a drag queen or transvestite.
(informal, often derogatory) A person characterised by both male and female traits, or by ambiguous male-female traits; a hermaphrodite.
